Class GuiRenderingHelper

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.helpers.GuiRenderingHelper
public class GuiRenderingHelper extends Object
Helper class for rendering logic extracted from GuiController. Contains exact same code, just moved to separate file.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GuiRenderingHelper(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane ghostPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane holdBrickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanelTop, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanelMid, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanelBottom, GuiColorHelper colorHelper)
    Creates a new rendering helper with the specified UI panels and color helper.

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiRenderingHelper

      public GuiRenderingHelper(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane ghostPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane holdBrickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanelTop, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanelMid, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanelBottom, GuiColorHelper colorHelper)
      Creates a new rendering helper with the specified UI panels and color helper.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - the main game board panel
      brickPanel - the panel for the falling brick
      ghostPanel - the panel for the ghost/shadow piece
      holdBrickPanel - the panel for the held brick preview
      nextBrickPanelTop - the top panel for next brick queue
      nextBrickPanelMid - the middle panel for next brick queue
      nextBrickPanelBottom - the bottom panel for next brick queue
      colorHelper - the color helper for styling

  • Method Details

    • setGameState

      public void setGameState(GameState gameState)
      Sets the current game state (affects rendering behavior).
      Parameters:
      gameState - the current game state

    • getDisplayMatrix

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] getDisplayMatrix()
      Gets the display matrix of background rectangles.
      Returns:
      the display matrix, or null if not initialized

    • getLastViewData

      public ViewData getLastViewData()
      Gets the last view data snapshot.
      Returns:
      the last view data, or null if not set

    • setLastViewData

      public void setLastViewData(ViewData lastViewData)
      Sets the last view data snapshot.
      Parameters:
      lastViewData - the view data to store

    • initBackgroundCells

      public void initBackgroundCells(int[][] boardMatrix)
      Initialise background cells: from the very beginning, use the final rendering style (no "blur then become solid" jump).
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the board matrix to render

    • initFallingBrick

      public void initFallingBrick(ViewData brick)
      Initializes the falling brick display.
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing brick information

    • initGhost

      public void initGhost(ViewData brick)
      Initialize the ghost/shadow piece overlay. Creates rectangles for the shadow block at the landing position.
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing ghost position information

    • initNextBrick

      public void initNextBrick(ViewData brick)
      Initializes the next brick queue display (up to 3 bricks).
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing next queue information

    • refreshNextBrick

      public void refreshNextBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the next brick queue display.
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing next queue information

    • initHoldBrick

      public void initHoldBrick(ViewData brick)
      Initializes the held brick display.
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing hold brick information

    • refreshHoldBrick

      public void refreshHoldBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the held brick display.
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing hold brick information

    • refreshGhost

      public void refreshGhost(ViewData brick, Consumer<ViewData> updateGhostPanelPosition)
      Refresh the ghost/shadow piece to show where the current brick will land. Updates both position and visual representation.
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing ghost position information
      updateGhostPanelPosition - callback to update ghost panel position

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick, Consumer<ViewData> updateBrickPanelPosition, Consumer<ViewData> updateGhostPanelPosition)
      Refreshes the falling brick display and related previews.
      Parameters:
      brick - the view data containing current brick information
      updateBrickPanelPosition - callback to update brick panel position
      updateGhostPanelPosition - callback to update ghost panel position

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board, Consumer<int[][]> updateDangerFromBoard, Consumer<ViewData> refreshGhostCallback)
      Refreshes the game background display.
      Parameters:
      board - the board matrix to render
      updateDangerFromBoard - callback to update danger zone state
      refreshGhostCallback - callback to refresh ghost piece after background update

    • clearBrickPanel

      public void clearBrickPanel()
      Clears the falling brick panel.

    • clearGhostPanel

      public void clearGhostPanel()
      Clears the ghost/shadow piece panel.
